meanings.definition: Stubbornness or resistance to authority or control.
meanings.sent1: Her recalcitrances towards her parents often led to arguments.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with the recalcitrances of a toddler can be challenging.
meanings.sent3: The cat's recalcitrances towards taking a bath provided comic relief for the family.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrances of the old tree roots made it difficult to build the new road.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrances of the wild horse made it impossible to tame.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being difficult to manage or control.
meanings.sent1: The recalcitrances of the computer system caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent2: The recalcitrances of the weather made outdoor events unpredictable.
meanings.sent3: The recalcitrances of the puzzle added an extra layer of challenge to the game night.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrances of the river's current made it hard for the boat to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrances of the wild animals in the zoo required extra safety measures.

meanings.definition: Unwillingness to obey rules or follow instructions.
meanings.sent1: His recalcitrances in class resulted in frequent visits to the principal's office.
meanings.sent2: The employee's recalcitrances towards safety protocols raised concerns among the team.
meanings.sent3: The robot's recalcitrances to shut down at the end of the day caused amusement among the engineers.
meanings.sent4: The recalcitrances of the weeds to be pulled out made the garden look unkempt.
meanings.sent5: The recalcitrances of the student to submit assignments on time affected their grades negatively.
